lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau cMpk byl ibbD ibQwr cwru bwsnw pRgt hoq Pul hI mY jwie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Chanpak Bayl Bibadh Bidaar Chaaru , Baasanaa Pragat Hot Dhul Hee Mai Jaai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as Champa (Michelia champacca) creeper is spread all over but its fragrance is felt only in its flowers.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy dRum dIrG sÍrUp dyKIAY pRisD sÍwd rs hoq Pl hI mY pun Awie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Droum Deeragh Svaroop Daykheeai Prasidha , Svaad Ras Hot Dhal Hee Mai Poun Aai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a tree is seen to spread all over but sweetness or bitterness of its character is known only from tasting its fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy gur gRXwn rwg nwd ihrdY bsq krq pRkws qws rsnw rswie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Gur Gyaan Raag Naad Hiradai Basata , Karat Prakaas Taas Rasanaa Rasaai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the Naam incantation of the True Guru, its melody and tune resides in the heart but its radiance is present on the tongue drenched with elixir-like Naam.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy Gt Gt ibKY pUrn bHm rUp jwnIAY pRqRXC mhwNpurK mnwie kY ]586]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Ghat Ghat Bikhai Pooran Braham Roopa , Jaaneeai Pratyachh Mahaanpurakh Manaai Kai ?586?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the Supreme Lord is residing completely in everyone's heart but He can be realised only by taking the refuge of True Guru and great souls.  (586)
